page.title: 16RELIGIOUS PROVISION
page.content: APART FROM THE ROMAN CATHOLIC NUNS WHO HAVE THEIR OWN CHAPEL WITHIN THE CONVENT AT PITSFORD, THERE IS NO ALTERNATIVE PROVISION FOR OTHER DENOMINATIONS THAN ANGLICAN. SEVERAL YEARS AGO THERE WERE TWO CHAPELS WHICH PEOPLE IN THE AREA MIGHT ATTEND - ONE IN PITSFORD, WHICH HAS SINCE BEEN CONVERTED INTO A HOUSE - AND ONE IN CHAPEL BRAMPTON WHICH WAS REPLACED BY A SMALL WOODEN HUT SOME YEARS AGO, BUT IS NEVERTHELESS STILL USED BY THE OLD. LOCAL ANGLICAN CHURCHES ARE "ALL SAINTS" AT PITSFORD AND "ST.BOTOLPH" IN CHURCH BRAMPTON. THE FORMER RECTORIES OF THESE TWO PARISHES ARE NOW PRIVATE HOUSES AND THE INCUMBENT OF BRAMPTON LIVES IN A SMALLER HOUSE ON THE SITE. PITSFORD HAS NO RECTORY AND HAS ONLY A SHARED PRIEST WITH THE PARISH OF KINGSTHORPE. SERVICES ARE HELD EACH SUNDAY.
